result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard T Gomez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
Pay supervision fees.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No contact with victim unless approved by the court.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
**Judge Jeffrey Kremers-02/19/16**
Defendant to spend 1 day straight time, with no good time credit, as condition time in the House of Correction for said Defendant's non-compliance with the aforementioned condition of probation. The stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date. Defendant taken into custody.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR COURT OBLIGATIONS RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Received and filed:
Order denying electronic release.
Copies forwarded to the parties on today's date.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for GPS monitoring.

Defendant Richard T Gomez in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 1 DAY of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
If agent needs a new date he is to contact the court.

Defendant Richard T Gomez in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to count 1:
Letter received and filed.
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. 
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at $265.00.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Defendant Richard T Gomez in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
The victim is in court and asking for an adjournment to determine how much restitution she is owed.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Richard T Gomez in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Victim was present in court today.
Case was calendared for a plea and sentencing today.
Defense counse is now requesting that a jury trial be scheduled in Branch 36.
Defendant informed by the court that all offers are revoked.
  Jury trial scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed:
Justice Point report.
cab

Defendant Richard T Gomez in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests a Plea & Sentencing date. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ashley S

Defendant Richard T Gomez in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Richard T Gomez in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
